data.title: LZ4 moved to more consistent place
data.body: Instead of separation from main framework I suggest insertion the LZ4 namespace into Content.Pipeline itself. Than it will not be an eyesore in documentation.

data.title: Possible to delete MGCB project when in use
data.body: When using a MGCB project with the pipeline tool, I found that it is possible to delete the .mgcb file during use. When building, I expected a new mgcb file would be generated, but that was not the case. Is this a planned feature of the pipeline tool? If not, is there a possibility that it would be implemented? I know that all content contained in the content builder project is loaded by the tool, so it shouldn't be extremely difficult to generate a new project using that.

data.title: Implemented GraphicsDevice.Present overload.
Small fixes
Fixed Error building Audio on MacOS
data.body: The ffmpeg /ffprobe files are not being set as executable. This fixes it

data.title: Cannot clone some required git submodules
data.body:
Hey all,

When cloning the repo today for use on my Win8 machine, I found that after running `git submodule init`, `git submodule sync`, and `git submodule update`, I can clone down the submodule in `ThirdParty/Kickstart`, but not the one in `ThirdParty/Libs`. I can confirm that the user @kungfubanana no longer exists (note that his name is no longer bolded when referenced), and therefore the dependencies that were contained in one of his repos no longer exist in one place. I am pretty sure that this has happened in the past few days, because he was referenced in https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/3430 only three days ago. Maybe we can contact GitHub and ask them for a copy of the repo? I'm sure that they have backups going back weeks if not months, which should be plenty far enough.

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4739008/5893538/59d7b424-a4b6-11e4-84c4-29eb1c29ddd2.PNG)

data.title: No access to disposable assets list in ContentManager
data.body:
The access to the LoadedAssets dictionary allows me to unload assets as necessary from my subclass of ContentManager. However, I only recently noticed that the ContentManager keeps a separate, inaccessible list of disposable assets which would create a memory leak in my case.

The simple solution is to make this list available to subclasses just as the LoadedAssets dictionary is.

I also have to ask what the point of this list is. Couldn't this be better handled by examining which objects are IDisposable in the LoadedAssets dictionary before it is cleared in Unload()?

In general I think the ContentManager could stand to have some improvements in functionality. If I were using XNA I'd be in a pickle since it's not really compatible with my simple case where assets need to be independently loaded and garbage collected rather than being managed by a ContentManager. For MonoGame I have to wrap my assets in Asset<T> which calls my own ContentManager.Unload(assetName) whenever its disposed or garbage collected.

data.title: code style improvement for gtk pipeline
data.body:
Welp here are the stuff I did:
  • Replaced tabs with 4 spaces
  • Remove unnecessary "this.", "Gtk."....
  • Sorted namespaces
  • Removed unnecessary "{", "}", "private"
  • Put in "var" in some places, looked much cleaner
  • Removed unnecessary casting.
  • probablly few more suttle changes like the ones above

data.title: Pipeline Tool Gtk# - Save option never enabled after editing.
data.body: When altering properties of a Processor or Importer the save button is never enabled. The only way to save changes is to hit the build button or use save as.

data.title: Adding A Linux Build Agent
data.body:
Should we add a Linux build agent to complement the Windows and Mac TeamCity build agents we already have?

The benefits:
- Could improve build times by having the Linux code build in parallel to Windows and Mac.
- We could catch build errors that only occur under Mono on Linux.
- We can run Linux unit tests on a actually Linux machine.

The down sides:
- Another agent to manage and maintain.
- Picking the Linux distro to support.

Any thoughts on this?

data.title: Calculate line height smaller than line spacing correctly
data.body:
When using SpriteFont textures, LineSpacing is the height of the tallest sprite (untrimmed).

MeasureString works incorrectly because it initializes the `finalLineHeight` variable with LineSpacing, then looks for taller sprites:

``` C#
if (currentGlyph.Cropping.Height > finalLineHeight)
    finalLineHeight = currentGlyph.Cropping.Height;
```

This will obviously never happen with SpriteFont textures. This PR modifies MeasureString so it initializes `finalLineHeight` with 0 and resets it to 0 at a line break.

I haven't tested it with SpriteFont descriptions where LineSpacing might be a correct value, so please test it. 

The biggest change is when you measure small characters, like a space which is represented as a 1x1 transparent pixel. It will return a height of 1:
`this.font.MeasureString(" ")` -> {18, 1}

How is the result of MeasureString "definied"?

data.title: Removed the RGBA->BGRA swap in FontTextureProcessor

data.title: Added not browsable to Exists param
Unable to read Compressed Texture on Android
data.body:
Hi, I think i've discovered a "strange" bug. When using MG and trying to open a compressed texture (DXT size 1024x1024) in Android it returns an error while reading the stream opened via the AssetsManager. The problem occours only when your texture "ends" with opaque white color (it works with black, haven't tried with other colors) I attach a simple image that cause the error.  This error could be related on how the Pipeline editor creates xnbs OR it is an Android BUG: For eg. If I add .xnb file extension into the "Leave the following resource extensions uncompressed" option, all works fine!

Failing Texture Example with Compression Enabled (DXT)
![back_21112](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7510826/5840687/b90f235e-a197-11e4-916d-0c76ff090d57.png)

data.title: Request: remove effects from Effect.EffectCache when effect is disposed
Pipeline Indicator Fix
Linux SpriteFont Processor doesn't use family names
data.body:
When building a spritefont file in Pipeline on Linux, mgcb searches for the font by filename, but not by family name. This means that a spritefont description won't build when asking for 'Arial', as the filename on most Linux systems is 'arial.ttf'. 

A way of fixing this would be to call into fontconfig, but should such a wrapper be implemented inside MonoGame or as a separate project?

data.body: Tree should be expanded by default, when adding files they're added to a closed branch, so the user needs to expand it afterwards (an UX problem).

data.title: Pipeline: files are not regenerated
data.body:
Resulting files are not regenerated when not deleted first. Maybe timestamp detection issue?

This is a requirement for asset creators: they need to be able to quickly regenerate. It would be even better if there was a way of watching changes in the input folder, so the app can run in background.

data.title: Application run loop workaround to support mono windows
data.body: This change will make MonoGame running on Mono-Windows, which will help deploying MonoGame based games without .Net framework.
